title: Integrating Meaning and Sensibility in Mathematics Education: Ontosemiotic Approach-Based Design for Enhanced Mathematical Representation and Communication

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding basic mathematical concepts, foundational experience in educational settings, and basic comprehension of mathematical terminology and linguistic expressions (grammar/vocabulary)
context.additional_context: For in-service educators, this program strengthens lesson design competencies using onto-semiotic approaches to understand meaning-making processes in math education. Focuses on linguistic expression (reading/writing) and interpretation of mathematical concepts, and facilitating peer mathematical communication (listening/speaking).

learning_goals: Apply the core concepts of onto-semiotic approaches (object, sign, meaning) to mathematics education and develop the ability to connect mathematical and linguistic expressions (reading/writing).

Integrate and analyze symbols, contexts, and cognitive elements to form the meaning of mathematical concepts and cultivate the ability to convert them into linguistic expressions (writing/interpretation).

Learners design three mobile-optimized microlearning activities and develop educational materials achieving over 4/5 (5-point scale) in meaning-construction satisfaction and over 3.5/5 in mathematical communication (listening/speaking) improvement in learner feedback surveys.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
